question:
It is 1999. Before you party like it is 1999, please assist me in settling a bet.

Fiona Apple and Paula Cole released albums prior to 1999. Of these albums, which didn't receive a letter grade from Robert Christgau? Provide your answer as a comma delimited list of album titles, sorted alphabetically.

trajectory.question:
It is 1999. Before you party like it is 1999, please assist me in settling a bet.

Fiona Apple and Paula Cole released albums prior to 1999. Of these albums, which didn't receive a letter grade from Robert Christgau? Provide your answer as a comma delimited list of album titles, sorted alphabetically.

trajectory.actor_reasoning: I need to find Robert Christgau’s Consumer Guide pages for Fiona Apple and Paula Cole to see which of their pre-1999 albums lack letter grades.

args.query: Robert Christgau Fiona Apple Consumer Guide Tidal grade site:robertchristgau.com

tool_executed.name: web_search
tool_executed.result:
Found 3 relevant web results:

1. Robert Christgau: Album: Fiona Apple: Tidal
   URL: https://www.robertchristgau.com/get_album.php?id=9359
   Site: robertchristgau.com
   Summary: Consumer Guide: · User's Guide · Grades 1990- · Grades 1969-89 · And It Don't Stop · Books: · Book Reports · Is It Still Good to Ya? Going Into the City

2. Fiona Apple - Robert Christgau: CG
   URL: https://www.robertchristgau.com/get_artist.php?name=Fiona+Apple
   Site: robertchristgau.com
   Summary: Consumer Guide Reviews: · Tidal [Work, 1996] Neither · When the Pawn . . . [Clean Slate/Epic, 1999] · Extraordinary Machine [Clean Slate/Epic, 2005] · The Idler ...

3. Consumer Guide Index by Year: 1996
   URL: https://www.robertchristgau.com/get_ylist.php?yr=1996
   Site: robertchristgau.com
   Summary: Fiona Apple: Tidal [Work]; Bass Is Base: Memories of the Soulshack Survivors [Loose Cannon]; Francis Bebey: Nandola/With Love: Francis Bebey Works: 1963-1994 ...

trajectory.actor_reasoning: I need to look up Robert Christgau’s reviews for Paula Cole’s pre-1999 albums to see which lack letter grades.

tool_executed.name: web_search
tool_executed.result:
Found 3 relevant web results:

1. Paula Cole
   URL: https://www.robertchristgau.com/get_artist.php?id=2095
   Site: robertchristgau.com
   Summary: Cole is just a romantic egotist who can't resist turning ordinary human problems into three-act dramas. Kate Bush fans will love her.

2. Consumer Guide Nov. 1997: Turkey Shoot
   URL: https://www.robertchristgau.com/xg/cg/ts97-97.php
   Site: robertchristgau.com
   Summary: PAULA COLE: This Fire (Imago/Warner Bros.) Before anyone knew she'd go platinum, netcrit Glenn McDonald presciently declared Cole the new queenpin of a ...

3. Get Label
   URL: https://www.robertchristgau.com/get_label.php?id=864
   Site: robertchristgau.com
   Summary: Label: Imago/Warner Bros. Artists. Paula Cole: This Fire [1996] C+.

trajectory.actor_reasoning: I need to open Robert Christgau’s detailed review pages for Fiona Apple’s Tidal and Paula Cole’s albums to confirm whether they have letter grades.

args.query: site:robertchristgau.com Fiona Apple Tidal Christgau Neither

tool_executed.result:

RSS Social Media: Substack Bluesky [Twitter] Carola Dibbell: Carola's Website Archive CG Search: Google Search: Consumer Guide Album Fiona Apple : Tidal [Work, 1996]

2. Fiona Apple - Robert Christgau: CG
   URL: https://www.robertchristgau.com/get_artist.php?name=Fiona+Apple
   Site: robertchristgau.com
   Summary: Fiona Apple. Tidal [Work, 1996] Neither; When the Pawn . . . [Clean Slate/Epic, 1999] A-; Extraordinary Machine [Clean Slate/Epic, 2005] A- ...See more
   Content: Robert Christgau: CG: Fiona Apple Consumer Guide: User's Guide Grades 1990- Grades 1969-89 And It Don't Stop Books: Book Reports Is It Still Good to Ya? Going Into the City Consumer Guide: 90s Grown Up All Wrong Consumer Guide: 80s Consumer Guide: 70s Any Old Way You Choose It Don't Stop 'til You Get Enough Xgau Sez Writings: And It Don't Stop CG Columns Rock&Roll& [new] Rock&Roll& [old] Music Essays Music Reviews Book Reviews NAJP Blog Playboy Blender Rolling Stone Billboard Video Reviews Pazz & Jop Recyclables Newsprint Lists Miscellany Bibliography NPR Web Site: Home Site Map Contact What's New? RSS Social Media: Substack Bluesky [Twitter] Carola Dibbell: Carola's Website Archive CG Search: Google Search: Fiona Apple Tidal [Work, 1996] When the Pawn . . . [Clean Slate/Epic, 1999] A- Extraordinary Machine [Clean Slate/Epic, 2005] A- The Idler Wheel Is Wiser Than the Driver of the Screw and Whipping Cords Will Serve You More Than Ropes Ever Do [Epic, 2012] A- Fetch the Bolt Cutters [Epic, 2020] A Consumer Guide Reviews: Tidal [Work, 1996] When the Pawn . . . [Clean Slate/Epic, 1999] For any Upper West Side showbiz kid, musical comedy is mother's milk, more "natural" than the rude attack of rock or the polite confessional of folk. And having gone mega, Fiona was autonomous enough to want it that way. With crucial help from Jon Brion, she's got the Richard Rodgers/Kurt Weill part down, and will surely tackle the Dorothy Fields/Lorenz Hart part later. Meanwhile, confessional attacks like "A Mistake" and "Get Gone" will do. Webber & Sondheim, watch out. A- Extraordinary Machine [Clean Slate/Epic, 2005] Instead of delivering the music a sharp-tongued breakup record by an empowered young female would imply--if not folk-rock plain and simple, then emotional piano-woman pop--Apple adapts Broadway show tune to confessional mode. Although Mike Elizondo adds momentum, Jon Brion's colors still predominate, and the melodic and structural contours are all Apple's. Ira Gershwin s

3. Xgau Sez
   URL: https://www.robertchristgau.com/xgausez.php?d=2019-01-15
   Site: robertchristgau.com
   Summary: [A] Do a Consumer Guide search on Fiona Apple on my site and find her reviews topped by Tidal's Neither. But at the bottom there's a link to ...See more
   Content: Robert Christgau: Xgau Sez Consumer Guide: User's Guide Grades 1990- Grades 1969-89 And It Don't Stop Books: Book Reports Is It Still Good to Ya? Going Into the City Consumer Guide: 90s Grown Up All Wrong Consumer Guide: 80s Consumer Guide: 70s Any Old Way You Choose It Don't Stop 'til You Get Enough Xgau Sez Writings: And It Don't Stop CG Columns Rock&Roll& [new] Rock&Roll& [old] Music Essays Music Reviews Book Reviews NAJP Blog Playboy Blender Rolling Stone Billboard Video Reviews Pazz & Jop Recyclables Newsprint Lists Miscellany Bibliography NPR Web Site: Home Site Map Contact What's New? RSS Social Media: Substack Bluesky [Twitter] Carola Dibbell: Carola's Website Archive CG Search: Google Search: Xgau Sez These are questions submitted by readers, and answered by Robert
Christgau. New ones will appear in batches every third Tuesday. To ask your own question, please use this form . January 15, 2019 [Q] Alright Robert, so you have to live on a deserted island for a
year. You can only bring one artist's discography to listen to. Whose
discography do you bring with you?
 -- Cody Holleman , Fort Worth [A] Kids are so cute. You apparently don't know that Greil Marcus edited a
book based on this silly premise called Stranded 40 years ago. We were supposed to pick albums, not
oeuvres, and although Dave Marsh concocted an imaginary compilation he
claimed he could jerk off to, most of us took our assignment as what
it was: a chance to celebrate a beloved album at essay length for decent money--$750, quite good
for the time, not to mention this one. I cheated by picking a UK-only
double-LP comprising both New York Dolls LPs. For your silly question
I'll be more literal, however, and say the choice would be between the
Beatles and Miles Davis and I'd probably chicken out and choose Davis
because he recorded so much with so many different concepts, attitudes,
grooves, and sonic gestalts. Sure I prefer Monk in real life. But he
just isn't as varied. [Q] You have reviewed ever

trajectory.actor_reasoning: I need to open Paula Cole’s artist page on Christgau’s site to see the grades for her pre-1999 albums, especially Harbinger.

args.query: Robert Christgau Paula Cole Harbinger site:robertchristgau.com

tool_executed.name: enhanced_search
tool_executed.result:
Found 1 web results with content:

1. Paula Cole
   URL: https://www.robertchristgau.com/get_artist.php?id=2095
   Site: robertchristgau.com
   Summary: Cole is just a romantic egotist who can't resist turning ordinary human problems into three-act dramas. Kate Bush fans will love her.
   Content: Robert Christgau: CG: Artist 2095 Consumer Guide: User's Guide Grades 1990- Grades 1969-89 And It Don't Stop Books: Book Reports Is It Still Good to Ya? Going Into the City Consumer Guide: 90s Grown Up All Wrong Consumer Guide: 80s Consumer Guide: 70s Any Old Way You Choose It Don't Stop 'til You Get Enough Xgau Sez Writings: And It Don't Stop CG Columns Rock&Roll& [new] Rock&Roll& [old] Music Essays Music Reviews Book Reviews NAJP Blog Playboy Blender Rolling Stone Billboard Video Reviews Pazz & Jop Recyclables Newsprint Lists Miscellany Bibliography NPR Web Site: Home Site Map Contact What's New? RSS Social Media: Substack Bluesky [Twitter] Carola Dibbell: Carola's Website Archive CG Search: Google Search: Paula Cole This Fire [Imago/Warner Bros., 1996] C+ Consumer Guide Reviews: This Fire [Imago/Warner Bros., 1996] Before anyone knew she'd go platinum, netcrit Glenn McDonald presciently declared Cole the new queenpin of a female tradition he traced from Kate Bush through Peter Gabriel, Melissa Etheridge, and Sarah McLachlan. Although McDonald sanely declared this genre the obverse of male-identified metal, a skeptic with no tolerance for subpeaks in either would like to note that each is beholden to "classical" precepts of musical dexterity and genitalia-to-the-wall expression. Where Kate Bush overwhelms petty biases as inexorably as Led Zep, Cole is just a romantic egotist who can't resist turning ordinary human problems into three-act dramas. Kate Bush fans will love her. C+

   Summary: Cole is just a romantic egotist who can't resist turning ordinary human problems into three-act dramas. Kate Bush fans will love her.

trajectory.actor_reasoning:
I checked Christgau’s pages: Fiona Apple’s Tidal is marked “Neither” (not a letter grade), Paula Cole’s This Fire has C+, and Harbinger has no review/grade entry; thus the non-letter-graded albums are Harbinger and Tidal.

FINAL ANSWER: Harbinger, Tidal

messages.content:
I checked Christgau’s pages: Fiona Apple’s Tidal is marked “Neither” (not a letter grade), Paula Cole’s This Fire has C+, and Harbinger has no review/grade entry; thus the non-letter-graded albums are Harbinger and Tidal.

FINAL ANSWER: Harbinger, Tidal
